hobby.message: Still dodging towers with those drones?
Political literature still your guilty pleasure?
The city looks different through analog photography, doesn’t it?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Path’s fine. Hardly anyone out. I keep it quiet—just take a detour after work, handle my own stuff. Spent some time flying drones, got what I needed. Didn’t stick around long. These days you don’t want to hang out anywhere too long.

Was straightforward, took the long route just in case. Not a crowd down here anyway. I mostly use the empty districts for flying my FPV drone. It’s… less monitored. Lately, a couple drones from the city have been showing up, which makes it less fun. Halden’s death must’ve changed something in the network. Feeds keep glitching. Minor thing, maybe.

Got here without trouble; streets are quieter these days. I spent the afternoon flying FPV drones as usual—industrial zone by South Grid is still the best. Been noticing more interference lately, though, after all that about Halden. Feeds break up, transit gates react slower. Makes the hobby trickier, which I guess is half the point.

Decent walk, except for a couple of slow queue gates—probably still fallout from Halden’s death, I guess. I had my usual fly at the tram depot first. Been flying freestyle FPV drones for years—it’s the only thing that lets me switch my head off. Lately, even the abandoned lots have city drones watching and the signal’s not as clean. Maybe it’s just the system getting twitchy, or maybe someone’s actually monitoring the airspace now. Makes me rethink how low I can fly, or if I want to risk carrying anything sensitive.

Not much traffic, but the city feels off. I was at the old depot, flying FPV quads—probably sounds odd, but it's been my thing since Uni. Freestyle, muscle memory, those little gaps between broken pillars—it’s how I process everything I can’t say out loud. Used to be you could vanish out there, but since Halden died the city started quietly watching the quiet places. Twice now, my video link cut out mid-flight, and my score dipped just for being off-grid a while. Makes me nervous. I even check for city drones now—not just for signal interference, but in case they care about the footage I bring home. You ever think about how even empty places don’t really feel empty anymore?
hobby_answer: Yeah, mostly. Haven't changed my launch spots much.
Just had to cut a flight short the other day—interference, probably upgrades in city tech.
They're tracking movement everywhere, it messes with some signals.
No point pushing it right now. System's kind of unstable since the official died.
I'm keeping it simple for now.
Still mostly clear. I watch the feeds before I go.
Lately, I'm seeing more city drones along the usual routes—even in the empty zones.
Interference got worse since news broke about Halden. Feeds drop more often now.
It’s making the flights less predictable. Not worth risking a system alert.
I don't stick around long—just in and out, safe spots only.
Clean enough to fly, but interference is worse lately. Lots of random drops on my goggles—wasn’t like this before Halden died.
Now I double-check the RF spectrum before every flight, even in the abandoned yards.
City drones aren’t aggressive but they keep circling low. Makes it feel less like downtime, more like someone’s watching.
Queueing in transit is slower after flights, too. System seems to lose track of permissions now and then.
Whole hobby’s changed a bit—used to feel like disappearing, now it feels like testing luck.
Most routes are okay, but it’s gotten weird since Halden went down—the RF band’s crowded and wristband glitches show up mid-flight.
Last weekend, my location failed to verify way out by the tram depot—never seen that before. Two city drones picked up my signal and hovered, like they weren’t sure about me.
My transit BCI flagged me for a slower pass heading home. Honestly, the backend must be a mess now they're running fallback systems.
Used to love how invisible I felt out there, now I notice the system reaching further. Kind of kills the headspace I go for.
I miss flying without feeling like someone's running checks on every movement, but maybe it’s just the new baseline.
Yeah, but clean’s a moving target now. System’s trying to compensate since Halden died—backend’s unpredictable, locks me out of frequencies I’ve used for years.

Last flight, out by the old depot, my video lagged and my band threw up a ‘location verification failed.’ Turns out, the compliance net’s covering way more ‘unused’ airspace now, and they’re running sweep drones on loops.
It hit hard—used to take my brother out there, before he disappeared in that BCI sweep. Haven’t felt safe since.
Miss those days flying through cracks in the system, blending in with dead infrastructure. Now feels like every flight’s a risk assessment, not an escape.
I still do it. Not sure if it’s habit, stubbornness, or just not wanting to let the Council’s chaos change what keeps me sane. Guess that’s how they get you—make adaptation feel like your own idea.
